channel.title: Ripple Carry Adder with IC's
channel.description:
I'm trying to make a 4-bit Ripple Carry Adder. This is what I have so far:
[img]http://img850.imageshack.us/img850/5954/32033723951260412131342.jpg[/img]
First of all can someone tell me what I'm going wrong? Because One LED is supposed to be on.
These are the configurations for each chip:
[b]CD74HC86E[/b] Quad XOR IC [img]http://img534.imageshack.us/img534/5600/30772423951272012421342.jpg[/img]
[b]M774LS08P[/b] Quad AND IC [img]http://img854.imageshack.us/img854/2132/30788823951276412531342.jpg[/img]
This is how I tried to put the LED's on the other side of the board: [img]http://img11.imageshack.us/img11/1231/30418923951266412281342.jpg[/img]
My original question was about if I needed resistors or not, but now it doesn't work. So I guess this is two questions. What did I do wrong and do I need resistors(if you could say why that would help).

item.title: Ripple Carry Adder with IC's
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“sp11k3t3ht3rd, post:4, topic:413528”][quote author=SETO link=topic=515027.msg3742697#msg3742697 date=1315510153]
OMFGINFORDUNOELECTRONICSCLASSALVOVERAGAIN, don’t you have a programmable IC, like the altera board? we used it and it was easier to diagnose errors cause the schematics would be produced from the code you write
[/quote]

I’m not in an electronics class if that’s what your talking about? I’m just doing this on my own. All I have are 2 of each chip so I’ll try the other chips to see if that works.[/quote]

Add the resistors!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Ripple Carry Adder with IC's
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Hi, my names bootnecklad and I’m resident TTL nerd.

I’ll come back to this when I have more than 10 minutes. Do you have a schematic that would make it easier. I could work it out from the wires but that would take longer then I would get bored then it wouldn’t get done.

If the circuit was working correctly before it died then your circuit is still fine. But you may have blown the ICs if you didnt put the resistor in.

Replace the ICs and add the resistors. Should fix it.

PROTIP: You don’t need the manufacturing crap before and after the device name. 74HC86 and 74LS08 would have done fine. Easier to read too!

Read full topic

I’m trying to make a 4-bit Ripple Carry Adder. This is what I have so far:

First of all can someone tell me what I’m going wrong? Because One LED is supposed to be on.

These are the configurations for each chip:

CD74HC86E Quad XOR IC

M774LS08P Quad AND IC

This is how I tried to put the LED’s on the other side of the board:

My original question was about if I needed resistors or not, but now it doesn’t work. So I guess this is two questions. What did I do wrong and do I need resistors(if you could say why that would help).
